title: Client Segment Risk COO Team
description:
Client Segment Risk COO Team

Job Number:

 3257974


POSTING DATE: Aug 26, 2024
PRIMARY LOCATION: Americas-United States of America-New York-New York
EDUCATION LEVEL: Bachelor's Degree
JOB: Wealth Management
EMPLOYMENT TYPE: Full Time
JOB LEVEL: Executive Director

DESCRIPTION


Morgan Stanley is a leading global financial services firm providing a wide range of investment banking, securities, investment management and wealth management services. The Firm's employees serve clients worldwide including corporations, governments and individuals from more than 1,200 offices in 43 countries.



As a market leader, the talent and passion of our people is critical to our success. Together, we share a common set of values rooted in integrity, excellence and strong team ethic. Morgan Stanley can provide a superior foundation for building a professional career – a place for people to learn, to achieve and grow. A philosophy that balances personal lifestyles, perspectives and needs is an important part of our culture.



The Client Segments Risk (CSR) COO team supports ongoing operations of the 600 person Client Segment Risk team, which includes Risk Officers, Business Control Units, and Conduct & Governance functions across all client segments. The unit is a first line of defense risk function responsible for execution of controls. This team partners with business stakeholders, second and third lines of defense to execute controls and assess and report on sales practice and operational risks and implement control processes and procedures.


**Responsibilities for this role will be:**


Support COO team with organization’s ongoing operations:


Headcount Forecasting


Communications Strategy


Training


Real Estate Planning


Reporting

  

Lead Strategic Projects

Talent Initiatives


Technology Projects


Ad hoc requests



**To be successful in this role, the candidate will need to:**


Quickly develop a working knowledge of all Client Segment business lines


Collaborate and build effective working relationships with employees across the organization


Build effective partnerships with colleagues in WM Risk and Client Segment businesses


Manage projects as needed and assigned; Deliverables are often related to ad-hoc and unanticipated requests, so a successful candidate must be able to work in an environment with evolving priorities, making sound decisions about prioritization and communicating immediately where there are real risks to on-time delivery


Work closely with Business, Technology and Operations related to incidents and projects


Partner with second and third-line control functions (Legal, Compliance, Audit, and Risk) on an ongoing basis

  

QUALIFICATIONS

At least 10 years of experience within Financial Services, with involvement in Risk or Wealth Management experience required


Prior experience standing up successful new processes and functions would be valuable


Strong leadership, and project management skills and ability to manage many competing priorities


Strong organization skills with the ability to multitask and prioritize; ability to work under pressure and to tight deadlines


Strong analytical and problem solving skills (critical thinking ability)


Excellent written and verbal communications skills


Detail-oriented and accurate


Ability to work in a team environment, build and maintain a network of contacts and coordinate with a large number of stakeholders


Proficiency in MS Office applications (e.g., Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Project)


Bachelor’s Degree required



Expected base pay rates for the role will be between 150000 and 250000 per year at the commencement of employment. However, base pay if hired will be determined on an individualized basis and is only part of the total compensation package, which, depending on the position, may also include commission earnings, incentive compensation, discretionary bonuses, other short and long-term incentive packages, and other Morgan Stanley sponsored benefit programs.

Morgan Stanley's goal is to build and maintain a workforce that is diverse in experience and background but uniform in reflecting our standards of integrity and excellence. Consequently, our recruiting efforts reflect our desire to attract and retain the best and brightest from all talent pools. We want to be the first choice for prospective employees.  



It is the policy of the Firm to ensure equal employment opportunity without discrimination or harassment on the basis of race, color, religion, creed, age, sex, sex stereotype, gender, gender identity or expression, transgender, sexual orientation, national origin, citizenship, disability, marital and civil partnership/union status, pregnancy, veteran or military service status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law.  



Morgan Stanley is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversifying its workforce (M/F/Disability/Vet).
company_description: Morgan Stanley mobilizes capital to help governments, corporations, institutions and individuals around the world achieve their financial goals.

title: Wireless Sales Representative - AT&T
description:
With almost 2,000 AT&T stores coast-to coast, Prime Communications is AT&T's largest authorized wireless retailer in the United States, and we want you to join us as a Retail Sales Consultant!



A Retail Sales Consultant (RSC) is a **brand** ambassador to our extraordinarily large base of customers nationwide. **Our RSC associates** serve the customer by demonstrating AT&T's vast array of products, services and entertainment options, **by** offering them **personalized and valuable wireless, entertainment, and connectivity** solutions to **fit their ever-evolving lifestyle** in a **fast-paced retail sales** industry.



Because we strive for the best, we offer amongst the best. Our current full-time Retail Sales Consultants earn a minimum base of ($25,000 + commission). Consultants could earn an average of $45,000 in total compensation in the first year when successfully meeting or exceeding sales goals in the first year. Commission is based on meeting outlined sales goals for a given market.



You'll also be eligible for some or all of our amazing Benefits Packages, such as:


* We offer New Hire Ramp Up Bonus payments for the first three months
* Training and Opportunity to grow
* Supportive team environment
* Medical/Dental/Vision, Paid Time Off, 401k and more


Not to mention some pretty cool perks such as:


* Latest devices and discounts on wireless service plans
* Using our technology, gain first-hand expertise to share with our customers
* Discounts on accessories and additional AT&T products and services, meaning you will always have access to the latest gadgets around


Dedication is always a good predictor of success at Prime Communications. Most Store Managers, were once RSCs, most District Managers were once Store Managers, etc. Join the community and forge your own sales path today!


* Provide extraordinary customer service by being compassionate towards and understanding their needs
* Build value by offering tailored and thoughtful solutions to fit each person, family or business
* Represent our Company and the AT&T brand with the utmost professionalism and courtesy
* Assist our leaders with store operations and duties
* Cooperate with your fellow RSCs to achieve a team approach to sales and customer service
* Achieve sales benchmarks and milestones (which can lead to that much needed extra bonus payment)
* Excel in selling AT&T's products/services, including entertainment, as we are a full-service lifestyle solution
* Work with wireless leaders to stand out, serve and succeed within the local community

Requirements:
**Requirements**


* Clear communication skills

Attitude and technical aptitude * - having an entrepreneurial spirit speaks volumes  

Commitment to exemplary customer service, honesty and integrity
* Background in retail sales is helpful, but not required
* At least 18 years old and legally able to work in the United States without restrictions.
* Ability to work a minimum of 32 hours per week including evenings, weekends, and holidays.
* Strong Social Media presence preferred
* Must have reliable transportation to location, off-site trainings, and meetings.
* Must live within 30 minutes of home store location with flexibility to work at multiple locations within a district as needed.
* Ability to operate a personal computer, wireless equipment, copier and fax.
* Adhere to Team Color policy while maintaining neat and professional appearance.


**Working Conditions**


* Ability to lift up to 10 pounds.
* Ability to bend, squat and stretch for purposes of inventory and stocking.
* Requirement to stand for long periods of time in order to provide the best customer service (with or without a reasonable accommodation).
* Ability to work in fast pace environment.
* Ability to follow instructions to completion.
* Ability to work under pressure, multi-task and handle customer complaints or requests.
* Ability to adapt to fluctuating noise levels and varied sounds from multiple media sources/devices.
* Problem solves under pressure.  

	+ Job Type: Full-time
	+ Pay: $40,000.00-$50,000.00
	+ Shift: 8 hour shift
	+ Weekly day range: Weekend availability

Our Housekeeping Aides are integral to the success of the childcare center by managing the organization and cleanliness that enables children to learn and grow in their environment.


**As a Housekeeping Aide, you:**


* **Keep things fresh!** Work to keep the building, classrooms, and playground in a clean, safe, orderly condition. Completes janitorial tasks such as vacuuming, mopping, dusting, cleaning windows, and restrooms. Gathers and empty trash.
* **Keep things working!** Assist in cleaning school equipment, furniture, fixtures, and walls. Clean restrooms and refill dispensers.
* **Keep things festive!** Assist with putting up and removing seasonal decorations and displays throughout the year.


**Job Requirements:**


* Comfortable working around children
* Willingness to learn and grow in a team environment
* Must meet state requirements for education and our center/school requirements.

title: Executive Director – Financial Crimes Regulatory Management Officer (Wealth Management, Investment Management and U.S. Banks Financial Crimes Risk)
description:
Executive Director – Financial Crimes Regulatory Management Officer (Wealth Management, Investment Management and U.S. Banks Financial Crimes Risk)

Job Number:

 3258030


POSTING DATE: Aug 26, 2024
PRIMARY LOCATION: Americas-United States of America-New York-Purchase
EDUCATION LEVEL: Bachelor's Degree
JOB: Wealth Management
EMPLOYMENT TYPE: Full Time
JOB LEVEL: Executive Director

DESCRIPTION


Morgan Stanley is a global financial services firm that conducts its business through three principal business segments—Institutional Securities, Wealth Management (WM), and Asset Management. Morgan Stanley provides comprehensive financial advice and services to its clients including brokerage, investment advisory, financial and wealth planning, credit and lending, deposits and cash management, annuities, insurance, retirement, and trust services.  


As a market leader, the talent and passion of our people is critical to our success. Together, we share a common set of values rooted in doing the right thing, putting clients first, leading with exceptional ideas and a commitment to diversity and inclusion. Morgan Stanley can provide a superior foundation for building a professional career – a place for people to learn, achieve, and grow.  


The WM, IM and U.S. Banks Financial Crimes Risk Team is embedded within the Firm’s business line. It is responsible for identifying, assessing, and escalating potential money laundering and reputational risk issues associated with higher risk client types. The WM, IM and U.S. Banks Financial Crimes Risk Team is considered the first line of defense and supports first line compliance with all relevant Financial Crimes regulations, standards, and policies.  



Responsibilities:

The Financial Crimes Regulatory Management Officer is responsible for leading and executing the firm’s first line Financial Crimes program for WM, IM and U.S. Banks. Specifically, focused on the regulatory compliance framework, ensuring business operations align with Financial Crimes regulations. In addition, this role will monitor regulatory developments and changes, assessing their impact on the firm’s operations and compliance requirements. This position will work closely with the business, the second- and third-line stakeholders to ensure the business is compliant with all relevant Financial Crimes standards, policies, procedures and applicable laws and regulations. The Financial Crimes Regulatory Management Officer ED will:
Provide subject matter expertise and guidance to the first line, on all Financial Crimes Regulatory matters.
Ensure first line compliance with all relevant Financial Crimes regulations, standards, and policies.
Prepare and deliver presentations and reports to senior management and board members on regulatory updates and compliance matters.
Conduct research and analysis on emerging regulatory trends and issues affecting the financial services industry. Monitor and report on Financial Crimes-related activities for the first line.
Collaborate with internal departments to ensure a cohesive approach to compliance and address any regulatory inquiries or findings promptly.
Assist in the development and enhancement of regulatory engagement strategies and frameworks.
  



In addition, other Key responsibilities include:
Collaborate closely with critical internal stakeholders including Senior Business Leaders, Second Line, Technology and Internal Audit
Maintain the first line current on changes in Financial Crimes regulations and overall regulatory environment.
Support organizational design and buildout of first line Financial Crimes framework, program and team.  


QUALIFICATIONS


Required Experience:

10+ years of relevant experience with BSA/AML Regulations within the financial services industry, or at a financial services regulator (e.g., FINRA, Securities and Exchange Commission, Office of the Comptroller of the Currency, Federal Reserve Bank, etc.)

Have an undergraduate degree in Business, Finance, or other related fields

Strong leadership qualities with the ability to manage teams and evidence a strong work ethic as well as a high degree of integrity

Expertise in implementing and executing on Financial Crimes Programs requirements

Expertise in international Financial Crimes laws and regulations and familiarity with best practice first line procedures and processes  



Ability to:

Handle highly confidential information with appropriate discretion

Direct and drive senior stakeholders towards a common goal and high EQ

Operate with confidence and comfort in high-paced and high-profile environments

Demonstrate prior experience and expertise with large scale organizational buildouts, remediations, high profile matters to senior management, Board and regulators  



Additional Skills Desired:
Post graduate degree, JD, MBA
Certified as an Anti-Money Laundering Specialist by ACAMS or equivalent AML certification/license is a plus
Deep knowledge of Financial Crimes regulatory requirements and expectations (domestic and international)
Strong time management and planning skills
First Line Risk & Controls, Compliance or Audit experience
Strong interpersonal skills and ability to communicate effectively both verbally and in writing
Experience in supporting audit and regulatory inquiries and interactions with Board, senior management, consultants

Morgan Stanley's goal is to build and maintain a workforce that is diverse in experience and background but uniform in reflecting our standards of integrity and excellence. Consequently, our recruiting efforts reflect our desire to attract and retain the best and brightest from all talent pools. We want to be the first choice for prospective employees.  

  

It is the policy of the Firm to ensure equal employment opportunity without discrimination or harassment on the basis of race, color, religion, creed, age, sex, sex stereotype, gender, gender identity or expression, transgender, sexual orientation, national origin, citizenship, disability, marital and civil partnership/union status, pregnancy, veteran or military service status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law.  

  

Morgan Stanley is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversifying its workforce (M/F/Disability/Vet).  

  

Expected base pay rates for the role will be between $150,000 and $235,000 per year at the commencement of employment. However, base pay if hired will be determined on an individualized basis and is only part of the total compensation package, which, depending on the position, may also include commission earnings, incentive compensation, discretionary bonuses, other short and long-term incentive packages, and other Morgan Stanley sponsored benefit programs.

title: Floral Designer
description:
The Floral Designer will represent 1-800-FLOWERS.com in a positive manner, and design merchandise to satisfy the needs of the customers, both retail and in-wire.





**ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS:**


* Contribute to creating a positive store image.
* Display knowledge of design principles and techniques, as well as current trends in floral design.
* Understand and utilize proper care and handling of all floral products as specified by 1-800-FLOWERS.
* Produce and design arrangements in an efficient and timely manner on a daily basis and during holiday production.
* This store has a standard arrangement production of 4 per hour (6 for core menu).
* Understand and maintain standard make-up inventories as specified by store.
* Understand and display the ability to accurately price make up according to store procedure.
* Conduct professional and effective customer consultations for weddings, funerals, parties, special events, etc.
* Prepare all orders according to invoice instruction.
* Assist in other activities as requested (i.e., staff training, workshops, etc.)


**UNDERSTAND STORE OPERATION PROCEDURES:**


* Daily maintenance of design area
* Inventory and ordering
* Turnover and rotation of flowers to reduce dump (use everything)
* Control cost of goods on an on-going basis
* Maintain the design area, clean on an on-going basis


**DESIGNER RESPONSIBILITIES:**


* Fill all orders according to invoice instructions and maintain the standard inventory of makeup at peak freshness in the cooler.
* Price-out all makeup items according to store procedure and follow standard recipes.
* Conduct wedding, sympathy, and other types of event and custom consultations with customers.
* Perform holiday makeup production.
* Assist in maintaining the design area, storage area, and makeup supply inventories.


The expected pay rate for this position is $17.00 per hour. The actual compensation will be determined by experience and other factors permitted by the law.


Requirements:
* Knowledge of design principles and techniques, as well as current trends in floral design.
* Ability to work Full time.
* Be available for extra hours and all floral holidays.
* Ability to lift up to 25lbs, stand for long periods, and traverse stairs throughout the day and work in an overall physically demanding manner.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.

title: Medical Receptionist - Clinical Lab
description:
This is a full time position: Monday - Friday, 7:30am -4pm with rotating Saturday shifts (8am - 12pm)

**Essential Job functions**:

* Greets visitors, patients, and families in a friendly professional manner and directs them appropriately.
* Maintains an efficient patient flow through the registration process and provides excellent customer service to patients/families.
* Promptly answers the telephone, directs all calls appropriately, takes an accurate message and delivers to the appropriate individual/demonstrates appropriate etiquette.
* Informs patients of delay in physician schedules, assists with patient comfort while delayed.
* Posts all self pay charges, collects payments, and provides patient with receipt. Accurately reconciles daily payments. Reconciles billing slips to daily schedule.
* Opens and closes batches properly, accurately reconciles collections, prepares deposits and documents corrections.
* Scans the insurance card, processes insurance verifications utilizing the on-line system, and updates the patient account. Updates patient information including demographics, insurance, HIPAA forms and financial waivers.
* Schedules appointments accurately according to department guidelines; using waitlist when applicable. Confirms future appointments as needed. Review Eligibility and Phone report.
* Schedules and enters orders for diagnostic tests, and procedures, following all appropriate workflows.
* Works cooperatively with Patient Care Resources and clinical staff to ensure timely pre-authorizations.
* Completes referrals according to departmental guidelines and properly enters into the appropriate system.
* Effectively communicates problems, concerns, or issues to the Office Supervisor / Manager appropriately and promptly.

**General Job functions:**

* Performs various clerical duties such as faxing, photocopying, scanning, filing and mailings.
* Demonstrates flexibility with various work schedules, covers for other staff when asked including other office locations.
* Demonstrates the ability to adequately follow downtime procedures.
* Other job duties as required.

**Physical Job Requirements:**

* Pushing and pulling, taking frequency and weight into consideration.
* Physical strength to lift heavy objects, carts, or items, taking frequency and weight into consideration.
* Physical mobility, which includes movement from place to place on the job, taking distance and speed into account.
* Dexterity of hands and fingers.
* Balance is maintained during climbing, bending and/or reaching
* Endurance (e.g. continuous typing, prolonged standing/bending, walking).

**Environmental Risks:**

* Chemicals, Chemotherapy and Fumes
* Loud noises
* Vibration
* Extreme temperatures
* Confined spaces
* Allergens: dust, mold and/or pollen
* Magnetic fields
* Radiation
* Sharps
* Latex
* Combative patients/visitors

**Blood-borne Pathogens:**

* Exposure to infectious hazards, blood, body fluids, non-intact skin or tissue specimens.
* Contact with patients or patient specimens are possible.
* Unplanned or unexpected exposure.

**Education, Certification, Computer and Training Requirements:**

* High School Graduate or GED required. Associate Degree preferred.
* Previous PSR experience preferred.
* Ability to communicate in English, both orally and in writing.
* Must have excellent customer service skills.
* Must have the ability to organize and perform multiple tasks in a timely manner.
* Knowledge of medical office and terminology preferred.
* Basic proficiency in computer use required. Previous experience with Standard Office Technology in a Window based environment preferred.
* Experience with EHR, Practice Management System and Departmental/Ancillary Systems preferred.

**Travel:**

* Travel to satellite locations as needed.

title: Behavior Technician - Essex County
description:
**About us**

Progressive Option Support Services is a multi-specialty group of therapists dedicated to providing a wide variety of therapeutic and behavioral services to adults, children, and families experiencing emotional and behavioral health challenges. A powerful presence in the behavioral health industry, Progressive Option’s personalized commitment to service and ability to facilitate rapid therapist placement have resulted in partnerships with many in the behavioral health sector. We continue to strive to provide the best services with the highest regard to quality, safety, and satisfaction.

For psychotherapy services, our practice provides support to adults, children and families. POSS primarily uses Cognitive Behavior Therapy and closely related subtypes to address unhelpful patterns of thinking. Cognitive behavioral therapy can allow clients to learn effective skills to improve their functioning and decrease stress. CBT has demonstrated positive outcomes in decreasing symptoms of anxiety and depression in adults & children.

Our Behavioral Health services also extends to children with ASD. POSS provides high quality Applied Behavior Analysis (ABA) services to children with a diagnosis of Autism, from infant to 21. Services are provided in the child’s home or at school either in person or virtually. Assessment, reassessment, supervision, and parent training are done by our Board Certified Behavior Analysts (BCBAs).

Progressive Option Support Services LLC is seeking Behavior Technicians and Registered Behavior Technicians to join our team!! We seek qualified and dedicated professionals to service children and families throughout Northern and Central NJ.

**Responsibilities** :

* Implement treatment programs for children with ASD

**Requirements** :

* Have access to reliable transportation
* Pass a criminal background check
* Comply with all HIPAA (confidentiality) laws as it relates to Protected Health Information.
* Be reliable, punctual, organized, and a self starter
* Must be creative, enthusiastic, and a team player!

**Qualifications:**

* At least 6 months of home-based ABA experience
* RBTs certification at least one year experience working with children with ASD
* BT a high school diploma and at least one year of experience working with children with ASD.
* Display excellent clinical competence and judgment; ability of working in a multi-disciplinary team environment
* Ability to train and supervise paraprofessionals in the delivery of 1:1 ABA services
* Ability to build strong, supportive relationships with parents and other caregivers
* Respect for cultural diversity and capability of adapting ABA procedures to that diversity
* Excellent written and verbal skills; detail oriented
* Strong leadership and management capabilities.
* Willingness to accept supervision and guidance, & remedy any identified deficits or weaknesses.

**Bonus Points:**

· Dual language behavior therapist are welcome. However, this is certainly not a requirement.

**Why Join Comprehensive?**

* Consistent opportunities at all levels – Per-diem thru Full Time
* Generous hourly rates/ Competitive compensation & benefits package for FT employees
* Ask us about our generous Referral Bonuses!
* Operations support to enable clinical team's sole focus on case and treatment management
* Opportunities for upward growth as well as access to Continuing Education courses.

title: Paralegal
description:
**PARALEGAL**

**Company Overview:**

Our legal team at NLLG are partnered with a reputable and growing debt restructuring company dedicated to providing financial solutions and relief to individuals burdened by debt. Together, we assist clients in achieving debt freedom and financial stability through strategic debt management plans. We are seeking a skilled and dedicated Paralegal to join our dynamic team in Wall Township NJ and play a key role in helping our clients regain control of their financial future.

**Job Summary:**

As a Paralegal at our debt restructuring company, you will be an integral part of our legal team, providing essential support to attorneys and clients throughout the debt restructuring process. Your primary responsibilities will involve conducting legal research, preparing legal documents, and facilitating communication between clients, attorneys, and creditors. The successful candidate will be detail-oriented, possess strong organizational skills, and have a genuine passion for helping others overcome financial challenges.

**Responsibilities:**

· Conduct thorough legal research and analysis on debt restructuring laws, regulations, and best practices.

· Prepare legal documents, including debt restructuring agreements, contracts, and settlement proposals.

· Assist attorneys in drafting legal correspondence and pleadings related to debt consolidation cases.

· Communicate and liaise with clients, creditors, and legal partners to ensure smooth case progression and timely resolution.

· Maintain accurate and up-to-date records of client interactions and case details in our database.

· Monitor and track the status of debt restructuring cases and keep all stakeholders informed of developments.

· Provide exceptional customer service to clients by addressing inquiries and concerns promptly and professionally.

· Stay informed about industry trends, changes in debt restructuring laws, and updates on creditor practices.

· Collaborate with the legal team to improve internal processes and enhance overall efficiency.

**Qualifications:**

· Associate degree in Paralegal Studies or related field; Bachelor's degree is a plus

· Paralegal certificate

· Proven experience as a Paralegal in debt restructuring or related legal field

· Knowledge of debt restructuring laws, consumer finance regulations, and creditor practices

· Excellent research, writing, and communication skills

· Proficiency in legal research tools and database management

· Strong attention to detail and ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously

· Empathetic and professional demeanor with the ability to handle sensitive client matters

· Team player with a commitment to achieving collective goals

**Benefits:**

· Health insurance for employees, mostly covered by the firm

· Health savings account available

· Paid time off and holidays

· 401K – 3% contribution by the firm, fully vested after 2 years

· Professional development opportunities

· Positive and collaborative work environment

This position offers a competitive salary along with opportunities for professional growth and development within the legal field. If you are a detail-oriented individual with a passion for law, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity as a Paralegal. Join our team today and be part of a company that makes a meaningful impact on people's lives!

To apply, submit your resume and a cover letter detailing your relevant experience and interest in this position. We look forward to reviewing your application.

*Note: This job description is intended to provide a general overview of the responsibilities and qualifications required for the role of Paralegal at our debt restructuring company. Actual job responsibilities and qualifications may vary depending on the specific needs of the company.*

Pay: $50,000.00 - $55,000.00 per year

* Health insurance

* Paid time off

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday
* No nights
* No weekends

* Paralegal: 2 years (Required)

description:
**General Summary:** This position is responsible working with the Accounts Service Coordinators and the shipping of production to wholesale footwear customers.



**Major Responsibilities:**

* Support Report sales process by providing exceptional customer service to both Customers as well as the Report Sales team. Provide information and reports as requested on inventory availability, pricing, open orders etc. Communicate date discrepancies and delivery issues, work with Sales and Customers on date extensions and order updates as needed.

* Review and accurately process/input all wholesale orders for Report branded customers into M3 system. Work with Report Production Coordinators to set up new styles as needed. Process other orders including Ecom, Employee Purchases, Promo Orders and Customer Return requests. Review EDI orders daily, follow up with customer regarding EDI discrepancies and load into system daily. Work with IT to trouble shoot EDI issues to get resolved as quickly as possible.


Allocated inventory to orders, process daily Pick and communicate with Warehouse to insures orders are printed, routed and shipped on time. Work with Warehouse to resolve system discrepancies and or labeling issues. Monitor receiving closely to insure inventory is received into the system and orders can be shipped as soon as possible.  

* 
* Assist Sales Rep and Accounting department with new customer account set ups (tracking credit applications and resale certificate). Work with credit card customers to submit payments prior to shipment of order. Work with Credit department to release credit hold orders and process returns.

Process Sample requests for all Sales Rep/Customer style outs, advertising, approval etc. Follow up and ship samples to customers.  

* 
* Review Open Order report daily. Prepare and advise status of Past Cancel, Bulks and Credit Hold orders during weekly meeting for your assigned accounts. Monitor Shipment ETA's and orders dates at quarter end.

* Follow up on Customer Compliance updates by updating account information in the M3 system and communicating new requirements for labeling, samples etc. to Production Coordinators.

* Other projects and duties as assigned including but not limited to running reports, responding to customer service issues, organization of samples and Showroom.

* M3 system
* Shoe product knowledge

* At least 1-2 years of administrative support experience required. Some retail background is helpful.

title: Sample specialist/ Merchandiser
description:
**Merchandiser/ samples specialist**

Roca is a global brand. It is a worldwide leader in manufacturing, distributing and marketing of high-quality ceramic and porcelain tile. The company’s product range offers solutions for multiple uses, from versatile wall tile to highly resistant indoor and outdoor floor tiles, including single colors, marble, wood, concrete, fabric, decorative tiles and a wide array of complementary pieces.

Visit: www.rocatileusa.com for more information.

**SUMMARY:** 

ROCA TILE USA is offering an exciting, full-time opportunity located in Edison, NJ as a Samples/ Merchandiser.

**Objective:**

A Merchandiser creates visual displays for flooring professionals. He/She communicates extensively with sales representatives to identify their goals . The job requires to keep up with market trends and have a good understanding of the retailer's target customers. He/she will be a key component to the warehouse team and assist in providing customers with their material.

A successful merchandiser requires a good balance of communication and artistic abilities. The merchandiser must clearly understand the goals of the flooring professional and keep them in mind as he/she develops merchandising strategies. Merchandiser is also required to interact with department managers to understand their goals and be aware of the amount of inventory they need to display and market. Besides budgetary considerations, he/she must take into account the physical space available for displays and calculate how often they must be changed to accommodate discounted and seasonal merchandise.

In addition he/she will be a key component to the warehouse team and assist in providing customers with their material. Providing customer service and making sure all the orders are correct.

**Responsibilities:**

· Store merchandising maintenance for showroom.

· Store merchandising set-up

· Store sampling

· Oversee panel production, storage and shipping

· Create/ edit labels and visuals

· Store walks and visits

· Follow up and CRM reporting

· Merchandising planning and supplier relations

· Regional Expansion and opportunities

· Product and bay expansion and opportunities

· Pack and ship orders via FedEx ground

**Requirements:**

* High School education. Associate Degree is a plus
* Energy and drive to achieve goals
* Able to work in a very multicultural, multifaceted team, dealing with people at different levels
* Effective time management, organization and multi-tasking skills
* Experience in multi-tasking and prioritization
* Able to promote the company’s values while supporting company goals for revenue and profitability
* Maintaining professionalism, diplomacy, sensitivity, and tact to portray the company in a positive manner
* Special people skills to deal with customers and an outgoing personality
* Very good team player and should work well under pressure
* Flexibility and willingness to work on any other duties or projects not otherwise specified in job description
* Medium knowledge of Microsoft Excel
* Fluent English.
* Spanish is a plus.
* Ability of travel at overnight stay two or three times a month

· The employee must regularly lift and /or move up to 25 pounds and frequently lift and/or move up to 50 pounds.

· Valid Driver’s License

ROCA TILE USA is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We do not discriminate in employment opportunities or practices on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, age, genetic information, disability or any other characteristic.

title: Quality Systems Specialist
description:
**Quality Systems Specialist** 

GameChange Solar is one of the fastest growing, most dynamic companies in the rapidly growing solar industry. We have top quality solar racking and tracker products that generate the most amount of energy, are the fastest to install, and the most cost effective.

This position is responsible for developing and controlling the Quality System of Game Change Solar. Position is mainly responsible for actively driving and ensuring adherence to ISO 9001 quality standards and expectations.

**Quality Systems Specialist** **Responsibilities:**

· Assist in maintaining and developing GCS Quality Management Systems (QMS) in compliance with industry quality standards-ISO 9001

· Provide support in collecting customer surveys from project sites and organize the details into overall customer feedback template.

· Provide technical assistance in inspecting and evaluating sample parts from suppliers globally at the headquarters office in Norwalk and report feedback to suppliers

· Formulate, develop and maintain process documentation, including Corporate Quality Manual, Quality Procedures, SOPs and Work Instructions

· Prepare and/or approve Quality documentations like FAI (First Article Inspection), product delivery clearances, vendor audits and RCCA (8D Reports)

· Collaborate with production/commodity team and manufacturing at suppliers to resolve quality aspects of products supplied to customers

· Participate and lead internal and external quality system audits. Ensure compliance with industry-specific quality standard-ISO 9001

· Collect and analyze supplier quality data to drive improvements. Communicate supplier related non-conformances with suppliers. Follow up necessary activities to eliminate risk of re-occurrences.

· Co-ordinate with product development and commodity team on supplier selection, assessment, yearly audits, and development opportunities

· Assist in handling information of non-confirming materials at customer sites, logging cases into ERP system associated with those NCM’s

· Support in investigate, evaluate, and resolve supplier quality problems, analyzing defect trends with ICA, PCA & RCCA, and leading continuous improvement actions

· Bring continuous focus on problem solving and improving process controls

· Get involved in Daily Management and proactively reduce the risk to Quality & Delivery by working on resolving potential issues with along cross functional teams

**FUNCTIONAL COMPETENCIES:**

· Ability to understand drawings and preparation of quality documents.

· Sound knowledge of Quality standards like ASTM, 8D method, PPAP, FMEA techniques and ISO 9001

· Data Collection and basic analytical skills

**Quality Systems Specialist** **Required Skills & Experience:**

· B.E. in mechanical engineering preferred

· Experience in use of basic inspection equipment (calipers, micrometers etc.)

· Experience in Rolling, Sheet metal stamping, Assembly, Manufacturing, Machining and Galvanization, etc. - preferably from industry which makes Steel/Structural.

· Good Problem-Solving and Communication skills

· Strong analytical ability with data reasoning and detail orientation

· Results orientation – must deliver results & have sense of urgency to deliver on time

· Collaboration – ability to work in cross-functional teams for achievement of objectives

· Functional excellence – Passion for Quality, must possess the necessary functional and working know-how

· Fluency in Verbal & Written communication –

o English (Mandatory)

**KEY RELATIONSHIPS:**

**Internal:** Manager, Operations, Engineering, Supply chain, Planning, Buyers and Logistics teams, etc.

**External:** Suppliers, TPI, External labs, ISO auditors, etc.

**Location:** Norwalk, CT (Hybrid) - 10-25% travelling to suppliers factories

**Principals only. GameChange Solar does not accept unsolicited resumes from recruitment agencies. PLEASE NO AGENCY CONTACTS.**

**WE ARE NOT ABLE TO PROVIDE SPONSORSHIP AT THIS TIME.**

title: After-School STEM Instructor
description:
Are you a tech enthusiast looking for a fun and rewarding part-time opportunity to inspire change? Look no further than ScholarStem! We're seeking a dynamic instructor to lead one of our after-school technology courses for elementary or middle schoolers.

**Topics we teach:**

* AI Art
* Coding
* Drones
* Podcasting
* Web Design
* Game Design
* Robotics

**Job Features**

* **Competitive Pay:** Hourly rate ranges from $50-$65, depending on experience and location.
* **Flexible Scheduling:** You have freedom in choosing your site, depending on its hours and location. We never place you without your input.
* **Growth & Impact**: Develop valuable skills and make a meaningful difference in the lives of hundreds of students daily. You also get rewarded for staying on the team through consistent pay increases and bonuses.
* **Diverse Opportunities**: Beyond teaching, engage in paid roles like curriculum design, contributing to company innovation, substitution roles, and earning through referrals.

**Hours and Location**

* **Multiple Locations**: Choose from multiple sites across the New York City metro area.
* **Convenient Timing**: After-school classes primarily run from 2:30 PM to 5:30 PM, typically meeting once or twice weekly, aligning well with various schedules. We also have opportunities during the school day!

**Instructor Requirements**

**1. Devotion to Education**: Seeking individuals with a genuine passion for teaching K-8 students. Your patience and skill in managing classrooms equipped with computers are essential. We maintain a favorable instructor-to-student ratio of 12:1 to ensure an effective learning environment.  
**2. Tech-Savvy and Eager to Learn**: While coding knowledge is a plus, it's not a prerequisite. We value your experience with technology and your enthusiasm for learning new, user-friendly programming languages. Your willingness to embrace tech advancements will be key.  
**3. Commitment to Punctuality**: Reliability is paramount. We expect all instructors to uphold a standard of absolute punctuality, as this is critical for the smooth operation of our classes and respect for student time.

**How to Apply**

If you’re interested in helping us provide tech education for future innovators, apply with your resume. We look forward to seeing you on the ScholarStem team!

**About us**

Join a team that's been making a difference in K-8 education since 2015. ScholarStem is a leading provider of after-school tech programs, and we're looking for passionate instructors who share our mission of delivering engaging, project-based tech curriculum. As part of our team, you'll have the opportunity to grow in your role and beyond, and we treat everyone as peers. Come join us and make an impact on the next generation of tech innovators!

title: Golf Shop Assistant
description:
**Golf Shop Attendant**

We're hiring a Golf Shop Attendant for ZSTRICT!

Whether you’re just kickstarting your career or have a long-standing passion for customer service and working with people, there’s an exciting new opportunity for you at ZSTRICT. Gain first-hand, in-depth customer service experience and engage with outdoorsmen from all over. Whether you’re in need of a part-time side hustle or just starting out, this is the perfect opportunity to seize the moment and develop lasting skills and relationships.

Ideal candidates are highly motivated, customer service-centric, and possess strong communication and interpersonal skills. Golf Shop Attendants offer friendly and expedient service to the property’s guests and assist the golf professional staff in golf shop operations, merchandise sales and other golf‐related activities. Beginners are welcome – while knowledge of golf is preferred, previous Golf Shop Attendant experience is not required for the position.

Ideal candidates have flexible schedules with availability to work weekends, holidays, and golf season, as needed.

Our team has made a conscious effort to ensure strong protocols are in place to keep you and our patrons safe, in and out of the shop, so you can focus on the customer experience, camaraderie, and shop management.

For more information on our open opportunities, apply today!

**Responsibilities**

* Maintain professional appearance
* Process customer reservations for guests of the golf course
* Provides customer service to arriving guests to help expedite check‐in process
* Arranges and displays golf shop inventory as necessary and directed
* Collects green and cart fees (and other revenue) from guests and processes in the point-of-sale (POS) system as trained
* Issues receipts for guest purchases
* Takes messages for staff or guests
* Assists in packing and unpacking inventory and golf operations supplies
* Assists in reconciliation of cash and accounts receivable charges to daily register at the closing of the day
* Performs clean‐up and closing procedures
* Perform other duties as assigned by supervisor or manager

**Education and Experience Requirements**

* Must be highly motivated, goal driven and self‐starter
* Must acquire basic computer knowledge
* Must have strong customer/guest orientation
* Must have strong communication and interpersonal skills
* Must be dependable
* Knowledge about the game of golf preferred

**Working Conditions**

* While performing the required duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to reach with arms and hands.
* The employee often is required to walk, stand, talk, or hear, handle, feel or operate objects.
* The employee must be able to lift and/or move up to 30lbs occasionally.
* The employee will occasionally be required to sit, stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl.
* Specific vision abilities include close, distance, color, peripheral vision, and depth perception.
* Noise level is moderately quiet
* Work extended hours during golf and holiday season
* Work weekends and holidays

**About Troon**

Troon is one of the largest owner-operator of golf courses, country clubs and resorts nationwide. We work hard and play hard. From pizza parties to bowling nights, to a company softball team and golf outings, there’s always something going on. Happy employees are productive employees, and what stands out is the pure joy and pride our team commits to its work. We are family – The Indigo Family. Join the family and learn more at https://www.troon.com

title: Clerical Associate Level III-Provisional Appointment
description:
**About NYC Health + Hospitals**
--------------------------------

  


Lincoln Medical and Mental Health Center is one of New York City’s premier acute care hospitals. Located in Downtown Bronx, Lincoln is a teaching hospital renowned for its Centers of Excellence, and a recognized industry leader in the implementation of state-of-the art medical technology and best practices. Our team of highly trained and caring medical professionals is dedicated to providing the highest quality health care that is safe, compassionate, culturally competent and patient-centered. Comprehensive services are offered in three major primary care areas: Medicine, Pediatrics, and Women’s Health in addition to more than eighty (80) specialty services. At Lincoln, the safety and comfort of our patients is our number one priority.


At NYC Health + Hospitals, our mission is to deliver high quality care health services, without exception. Every employee takes a person-centered approach that exemplifies the ICARE values (Integrity, Compassion, Accountability, Respect, and Excellence) through empathic communication and partnerships between all persons.


Visit us at www.nyc.gov/html/hhc/lincoln.


**Job Description**
-------------------

  


**Purpose of Position:**


To systematically approach patients by registering and processing patients entering the clinic and to accomplish the following:

* To clearly delegate and outline individual clerical responsibilities and serve as guide and reference.
* To help contribute towards adequate and effective continuity of patient care by providing for sustained and efficient patient flow and productive utilization of clerical personnel.
* To facilitate accurate and timely billing and reimbursement.
* To enhance the patient experience and facilitate clinic flow.
* To augment and enhance work performance and morale of clerical personnel.
* To ensure proper and timely revenue workflow.

**Intake Processing (All of Ambulatory Care):**

* Greet patients in a courteous and professional manner using “**A**cknowledge, **I**ntroduce, **D**uration, **E**xplanation, **T**hank you.
* Practicing improvement in patient and employee experience through iCare.
* Ask the patient for two (2-3) identifiers to ensure the patient’s safety.
* Verify appointment by checking against the **D**etailed **A**ppointment **R**eport (DAR) in the scheduling system. Or utilizing the Snapboard. If the patient does not have an appointment, the clerk will request the intervention of the nurse in charge for further determination of the patient’s medical needs and disposition, or, if the patient can be accommodated in a “Same Day” slot for the provider and/or walk-in clinic.
* Check Managed Care assignment and PCP verification. The clerical Associate must verify who the PCP is to assure that patient is seeing their Primary Care Provider. Specialty Clinic, the Clerical Associate will verify referral in the EMR.
* If so instructed by nurse, clerical associate schedule as “same day” and categorizes in the scheduling system as “WALK-IN” or “URGENT”, if indicated.
* If a patient has an appointment, checks patient in the scheduling system, the patient will appear ready, and hands off to PCA, nurse, or provider (or the next person seeing the patient).
* Record intake time on the scheduling system for cycle time processing, if indicated.
* Open encounter in EMR

**Exiting Process**:

* Review registration/disposition AVS (After Visit Summary) and wrap-up instructions.
* Issue next practice appointment as per provider’s written instructions (some areas PCAs will give the appointment).
* Issue referral appointments when appropriate (does not apply to e-consults)
* For e-consult remind patient that someone will call them with an appointment once specialist assigns a disposition for the e-consult
* If indicated by provider, clerical associate will change patient’s PCP and/or Alt PCP.
* If needed, sends referral for HMO authorization before going to the Specialty Clinic.
* For patients requiring carfare reimbursement (i.e., Medicaid insured patients), prepares as per carfare reimbursement procedure and gives to patient as needed.
* Check out patient in scheduling system (some areas PCA is responsible). This will record exact exit time (cycle time). Ensure that all patients have been clicked out for each session (am/pm), and collects any payments not collect at check-in.

**Additional Duties:**

* Answer telephone, relays messages, and directs accordingly.
* Utilizes secure chat in EMR system to communicate with multidisciplinary team when necessary
* Adhere to Outpatient Referral Procedures when indicated.
* Is responsible for enhancing personal and professional development through attendance at required and mandated training sessions.
* Is responsible for wearing professional attire to the workplace as well as during off-site work when conducting business on behalf of Lincoln Hospital Center, as per dress attire policy.
* Adhere to the Mission/Vision/Value Statement and Guiding Principles of the Organization in all endeavors.
* Monitors and fixes work queues for registration errors and referrals to the department.
* Collection of co-payments during check-in- closing out drawer and securing petty cash bag with practice manager/supervisor




**Minimum Qualifications**
--------------------------

  


1. A high school diploma or its educational equivalent; and  

  

2. Six (6) months of full-time satisfactory clerical experience and/or experience interacting with the public, such as processing sales; taking, processing, and delivering orders; obtaining and dispensing information; listening to and resolving customers concerns, problems, and complaints; and/or performing related customer service activities.


**How To Apply**
----------------

  


If you wish to apply for this position, please apply online by clicking the "Apply Now" button or forward your resume, noting the above Job ID #, to:  

  

Lincoln Medical & Mental Health Center  

Human Resources Department  

234 Eugenio Maria De Hostos Blvd, (East 149th Street),  

2nd Floor, Annex  

Bronx, NY 10451  

Attn: Recruitment Unit


NYC Health and Hospitals offers a competitive benefits package that includes:

* Comprehensive Health Benefits for employees hired to work 20+ hrs. per week
* Retirement Savings and Pension Plans
* Loan Forgiveness Programs for eligible employees
* Paid Holidays and Vacation in accordance with employees' Collectively bargained contracts
* College tuition discounts and professional development opportunities
* Multiple employee discounts programs

title: Fitness Coach / Corrective Exercise Specialist
description:
Job Summary

The Fitness Coach represents 24 Hour Fitness to members and clients by delivering a positive fitness experience and quality personal and small group training sessions leading to member retention and client acquisition. The Fitness Coach leverages experience and specialized education to deliver premium programming and consultation for clients in person.

Essential Duties & Responsibilities

**Service and Train Clients**

* Design and deliver comprehensive fitness programs based on clients' goals that include appropriate exercise selections, programs that include varied fitness offerings, general nutrition guidelines and teaching a fitness lifestyle.
* Inform clients of fitness tools available to assist them in achieving their goals.
* Set expectations and hold clients accountable to their comprehensive fitness programs through goal setting, follow up discussions and track progress.
* Demonstrate safe and proper exercise techniques to clients.
* Arrive on time, prepared and enthusiastic while being attentive for every training appointment and or group session.
* Meet minimum productivity expectations servicing clients and group sessions.
* Increase member group training sessions and attendance through strong teaching skills and ability to connect with and motivate others with a wide variety of fitness levels.

**Service Members and Administration**

* Assist in member service activities such as fitness seminars, training days, and deliver a positive fitness experience to members and guests through complimentary fitness assessments.
* Build and generate a strong fitness business through new client acquisition and retention.
* Effective onboarding of new members and clients by providing professional recommendations to help acclimate to a fitness lifestyle.
* Coach members on proper use of equipment and exercise techniques.
* Start and finish sessions as scheduled.
* Handle member concerns or direct to appropriate club management.
* Deliver on the Service Promise of Clean, Friendly and Well-Maintained Club by racking weights, team cleans and assisting with maintaining a clean and organized club.
* Create, maintain, and regularly update progress for each personal training client, following company guidelines.
* Schedule personal training sessions, other appointments and administration of time four weeks in advance using company systems.

title: Aesthetic Registered Nurse
description:
Elite Aesthetics is a luxury medical spa dedicated to providing our clients with transformative aesthetic treatments and services. We are seeking an experienced and passionate Registered Nurse (RN) to join our elite team. We offer competitive compensation with the ability to grow in our new Flatiron District location.

**About Elite Aesthetics**

**Vision:** "Elevate with Elite" – This phrase represents our overall mindset at Elite Aesthetics. We are always striving to elevate and be the best versions of ourselves as a business and service providers, extending to everything we do. We are continuously looking to improve and rise to be our best.

Our purpose is to elevate ourselves as role models for our clients, who we encourage to be their best, most confident selves, whatever that means to them. We're here to assist them in that journey.

**Mission Statement:** We believe in natural, patient-focused results provided with passion, integrity, and a dedication to customer commitment. We help you build your confidence with detail-oriented and innovative treatments.

**Core Values:**

**- Excellence:** We are committed to providing the highest quality care and services to our clients, exceeding their expectations in all aspects of their experience with us.

**- Leadership:** We lead by example, setting the standard for professionalism, innovation, and ethical practices in the medical aesthetics industry.

**- Integrity:** We uphold the highest ethical standards, always acting with honesty, transparency, and respect in all our interactions.

**- Teamwork:** We value collaboration and support each other as a cohesive team, working together to achieve our shared goals and deliver exceptional results.

**- Empathy:** We approach each client with compassion, understanding their unique needs and concerns to provide personalized care and support throughout their aesthetic journey

**Position Summary:** The Registered Nurse (RN) will work collaboratively with our team to provide comprehensive aesthetic healthcare services. This includes conducting client consultations, developing treatment plans, administering injectables and other medical aesthetic services, and ensuring safe, effective treatments.

Key Responsibilities:

* Evaluate clients and assess needs to create personalized treatment plans
* Perform Morpheus8, Lumecca IPL, SkinPen treatments, Hydrafacial
* Administer injectables such as neurotoxins and dermal fillers with exceptional technique
* Educate and prepare clients regarding procedures, risks, aftercare, and expectations
* Monitor clients' progress and results, adjusting plans as needed
* Maintain detailed documentation of all client interactions and treatments
* Collaborate with the team to uphold the highest standards of care
* Stay current on industry advancements through continuing education

Qualifications:

* Active Registered Nurse (RN) license in the state of practice
* Minimum 2 years of experience as a Registered Nurse (RN), preferably in aesthetics or dermatology
* Extensive knowledge of aesthetic treatments, products, devices and injectables
* Excellent diagnostic, assessment and decision-making abilities
* Outstanding interpersonal skills to build client relationships and trust
* Commitment to superior client care and quality assurance

Join our elite team dedicated to providing unparalleled aesthetic healthcare. We offer a cutting-edge environment. Apply now to be part of our mission to enhance natural beauty through innovative, results-driven aesthetic medicine.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $45.00 - $50.00 per hour

Expected hours: 8 per week

Physical Setting:

* Med spa

Supplemental Pay:

* Commission pay

Experience:

* Med Spa: 1 year (Required)
* Hydrafacial: 1 year (Preferred)
* Morpheus8: 1 year (Preferred)
* Lumecca IPL: 1 year (Preferred)

License/Certification:

* Certified Registered Nurse (Required)

title: Complex Manager
description:
**Job Summary**

This position will be responsible for overseeing the daily operations of services for our client, including but not limited to planning and execution of various size food plant sanitation services, leading, and directing your team, and delivering the highest quality of service to the client.

**Duties & Responsibilities**

Direct various sanitation services to meet customers’ needs.

Managing the workflow of the team by assigning task, supporting staff, monitoring results, and reporting to upper Management.

Contributes to the cleaning strategy by knowing the business goals and how to achieve them.

Schedules all needed labor, equipment, and supplies to perform services.

Inspect work performed to ensure it meets specifications and standards established by the company and customer.

Ensure all employees follow proper GMPs, and OSHA standards and work in a controlled/safe environment.

Ensure the customer remains in compliance with sanitation industry standards.

Complete and maintain all paperwork required (i.e., daily budget, daily MSS, daily logs, SSOPs).

Act as on-site Human Resources through reporting of proper documentation/recording of incidents to Area Manager and Corporate Office HR, resolve employee disputes, submit payroll, and evaluate employees’ performances.

Report any issues, concerns, or important occurrences with the customer to direct management in a timely manner.

Hire and train all new employees on their specific job tasks and safe working procedures.

Perform miscellaneous duties and responsibilities as deemed necessary.

**Skills & Qualifications**

Must be 25 years of age or older.

Must have reliable transportation.

Detail-oriented and organized.

Excellent communication skills. Ability to speak Spanish a plus.

Ability to multi-task, work independently, and work well in a team setting.

Able to effectively lead a team.

Follow and relay oral and written instructions, policies, and procedures.

Demonstrated ability to analyze and resolve problems.

Ability to work in a fast-paced environment.

Be Positive, display a “Can Do” attitude.

Time management skills.

**Position Type and Expected Hours of Work**

This is a full-time position. May be required to work some weekends.

**Physical Demands**

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job.

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to use hands to finger, handle or feel; reach with hands and arms; and talk or hear. The employee frequently is required to stand; walk; stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl. The employee is occasionally required to sit and climb or balance. The employee must regularly lift and/or move objects up to 40 pounds and frequently lift and/or move objects up to 50 pounds. Must be able to operate and use all necessary equipment.

**Education & Experience**

Prior food plant sanitation experience required.

Prior management experience required.

High School Diploma, GED, or equivalent years’ experience preferred.

title: Merchant Services Outside Sales Account Manager
description:
**About Us**

Betterpay, LLC is a leading provider of Merchant Acquiring and Payments Solution. Our main processing partner is Paysafe.

Betterpay is a Registered Independent Sales Organization ***registered*** with Visa and MasterCard, through our sponsoring Bank, **Citizens Bank.**

Betterpay was created on the principle that all merchants, regardless of their size, deserve better tools and payment solutions to maximize their profits and growth. We believe their business’s basic need to accept card payments from their customers should not distract them from running their company and come with great support at a fair deal.

**About the Position**

At Betterpay, our goal is to make the life of business owners simpler. We achieve this by providing our customers with solutions that save them time and money. Our products and services, backed by in-house support, include card processing, point-of-sale systems, payroll, and sales-building tools.

**We are excited to expand our growing team.**

Betterpay is seeking a Account Manager who is a natural hunter of sales and who has direct experience selling merchant services. The ideal candidate thrives under pressure to meet sales goals and has a desire to exceed them, maximizing their earning potential (uncapped).

**This is a 1099 position that offers an upfront activation bonuses and residual split.**

**Responsibilities**

* Have a clear understanding of all Betterpay products and services.
* Present Betterpay value propositions competently.
* Self-generate leads in the business community, including Chambers of Commerce, local associations, merchant groups, community banks, and business owners.
* Enter activity into CRM to stay organized and assist leadership win developing accurate metrics.
* Manage prospect and opportunity pipelines through consistent funnel management.
* Continue sales development by attending regularly scheduled sales and product sessions.
* Ability to work in a cooperative and supportive manner with the executive leadership team.
* Receive coaching and feedback and demonstrate a willingness to implement recommendations into the sales process.

**Requirements**

* **A minimum of 2+ years' experience in selling Merchant Services \\*\\* A Plus\\*\\***
* Self-motivated with a proven track record of success
* B2B sales experience
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills
* A strong personal and professional network with an active, robust pipeline of business owners and referral partners
* Excellent business acumen
* Takes on personal accountability for establishing and achieving prospecting and sales goals.
* Work with integrity, a positive attitude, and being a team player at all times while driving to leave a mark in the industry.
* Ability to thrive under pressure.
* A driving need to succeed.
* Valid Driver’s License with reliable, insured vehicle.
* Proficiency in MS Office applications, e.g., Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook

**Benefits**

* Lifetime Residual Income.
* Signing Bonuses per account.
* Remote Work
* A transparent and collaborative environment
* Residuals are paid monthly based on profits earned from the previous month.
* Upfront bonuses for each new account are paid weekly based on accounts boarded and processing.
* Earn commissions on Equipment Purchases, Cash Advances, and on Set-up fees.
* **WE DO NOT HAVE MINIMUM PRODUCTION REQUIREMENTS.**
* **WE PAY 100% OF THE PROFITS ON EQUIPMENT PROFITS AND LEASES.**
* You will earn, based on your production.

Betterpay is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Betterpay does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, non-disqualifying physical or mental disability, national origin, veteran status or any other basis covered by appropriate law. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit, and business need.

In other words: **Be Better! And we are!** Our commitment to our merchants.

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time

Benefits:

* Flexible schedule

Shift:

* 8 hour shift
* Day shift

Experience:

* Marchant Services Sales: 2 years (Preferred)
* Self-Prospecting B2B Sales: 2 years (Preferred)
* Account Management: 2 years (Preferred)

Work Location: In person

title: Coordinator, Production & Operations
description:
**Company Description**  

We create world-class content, which we distribute across our portfolio of film, television, and streaming, and bring to life through our theme parks and consumer experiences. We own and operate leading entertainment and news brands, including NBC, NBC News, MSNBC, CNBC, NBC Sports, Telemundo, NBC Local Stations, Bravo, USA Network, and Peacock, our premium ad-supported streaming service. We produce and distribute premier filmed entertainment and programming through Universal Filmed Entertainment Group and Universal Studio Group, and have world-renowned theme parks and attractions through Universal Destinations & Experiences. NBCUniversal is a subsidiary of Comcast Corporation.

  

Here you can be your authentic self. As a company uniquely positioned to educate, entertain and empower through our platforms, Comcast NBCUniversal stands for including everyone. Our Diversity, Equity and Inclusion initiatives, coupled with our Corporate Social Responsibility work, is informed by our employees, audiences, park guests and the communities in which we live. We strive to foster a diverse, equitable and inclusive culture where our employees feel supported, embraced and heard. Together, we’ll continue to create and deliver content that reflects the current and ever-changing face of the world.

 **Job Description**  

* Maintain order and upkeep of executive suite – includes preparing for meetings and handling all supplies, correspondence, and other requests
* Manage schedules, expenses, meetings and calendars for production executives
* Participate and take notes for conference calls and function as an extension of the executive team – adding input and assisting where necessary
* Collaborate with marketing team to generate social media posts, LinkedIn blogs, and website content for the studio
* Brainstorm and execute ideas for new business including cold calls, email campaigns, LinkedIn outreach, etc
* Act as point of contact for Stamford community leaders and groups in regard to city events and Community Service projects, as well as off-site special events.
* Other projects as assigned

  

**Qualifications** **Basic Requirements:**

* Bachelor’s Degree
* Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Office (Outlook, Word, PowerPoint, Excel)
* Self Starter who proactively seeks out tasks and opportunities for growth

**Desired Characteristics:**

* Minimum 1 year of production experience or marketing experience in a TV setting preferred
* Strong interpersonal skills and entrepreneurial spirit
* Detail oriented
* Ability to multi-task and prioritize assignments under high pressure in a fast-paced environment
* Ability to follow direction and work independently when necessary
* Interest in daytime talk TV

**Additional Requirements:**

* **Required On-Site:** This position is required to be performed full-time from at Stamford Studios.

  

**Additional Information**  

NBCUniversal's policy is to provide equal employment opportunities to all applicants  

and employees without regard to race, color, religion, creed, gender, gender identity  

or expression, age, national origin or ancestry, citizenship, disability, sexual  

orientation, marital status, pregnancy, veteran status, membership in the uniformed  

services, genetic information, or any other basis protected by applicable law.

title: Chef de Cuisine
description:
CHEF DE CUISINE

The Chef De Cuisine ensures all the needs of the kitchen are met, the menu is executed consistently and at the highest level, the kitchen is impeccable, and costs are in line for a sustainable operation. As the head of the Back of House team, this position is a leader to the kitchen staff, leading by example and training and developing old and new members of the team alike. The Chef De Cuisine is overall accountable for everything happening in the kitchen.

The Chef De Cuisine is accountable to the Business Director and the Culinary Director, who will support with high level operation and brand input, staff management and troubleshooting, and ensuring all expectations on cleanliness, execution, brand excellence, and impeccability are met. The Chef De Cuisine will work with the Culinary Director on menus, tastings, and culinary programming.

The Chef De Cuisine will partner with the Business Director and Front of House Managers of the restaurant to ensure that all of the restaurant’s needs are being handled, and that the Front and Back of House communication is at the highest level.

The role will work with ownership and HQ to position the restaurant as both a profitable business and a dining destination. In addition to the regular weekly schedule of management shifts, the Chef De Cuisine will be expected to attend weekly manager meetings, and trainings as offered by Smith. In addition to a great work ethic and strong leadership skills, the ideal candidate will possess the following skills and attributes:

* Work well in a fast-paced, high-pressure environment.
* Well-versed in scheduling, management, and the administrative side of running a kitchen.
* Business acumen and an ability to dive into sales and cost numbers.
* Continued commitment to professional growth and development.
* Able to work as a team and align to a shared vision

Salary negotiable with experience. Semi-annual Bonus program offered.

title: Managing Attorney
description:
**Managing Attorney Acacia UCP**

New York, NY  
Hybrid – 2 days onsite

Be a part of a nonprofit organization dedicated to providing nearly 11,000 young people each year with free, integrated services to help them transition successfully into adulthood. As the Managing Attorney, you will oversee a team of 3-5 attorneys and paralegals while managing your own caseload. You will be accountable for all aspects of the team’s performance, including supervision, productivity, and grant compliance.

* Lead a diverse team of attorneys, paralegals, social workers, administrative assistants, interns, and volunteers, ensuring the highest standard of legal work

* Coordinate with partners in immigration, legal services, and youth development sectors

* Represent the organization in advocacy efforts at both local and national levels
* Conduct annual staff performance reviews
* Assist in recruiting and training new attorneys, paralegals, interns, and volunteers
* Serve as Acting Legal Services Director in the Director's absence
* J.D. degree and admission to the New York State Bar or willingness to sit for the next available exam
* 5+ years of experience in immigration and/or family law
* Experience in supervising attorneys and in managing projects
* Knowledgeable of and ability to apply positive youth development principles to working with young people

title: Project Manager (Digital Agency)
description:
*Do you want to work in a fast-paced environment with a creative and passionate team where your contributions will have a real impact?*

*Are you a passionate project manager that enjoys working across teams to deliver exceptional results for clients?*

If the answer to the above questions is yes and you are looking to develop a career with growth opportunity, recognition and reward for the achievement of business results, we’d love to speak with you.

**About Omnizant ®**  
Omnizant is a rapidly growing web design and digital marketing agency that provides state-of-the-art marketing and technology solutions for law firms and other professional organizations.. Although we’re an established business, we maintain a start-up mentality where every person’s unique abilities are celebrated. We know that we're only as strong as our employees, and we empower our team members to grow professionally while having fun along the way.

**About the Role**  
We are seeking a highly organized person with a passion for planning and marketing and experience with the project management tool, **monday.com**, to join our digital agency. As a Project Manager, you will play a crucial role in overseeing the delivery of marketing assets to our clients. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams, ensuring that projects are executed efficiently, on time, and within budget.

**Responsibilities:**  
Project Planning and Execution: Using monday.com, develop comprehensive project plans, timelines, and budgets in collaboration with internal teams and clients. Monitor project progress, identify potential roadblocks, and take proactive measures to keep projects on track. You will be responsible for collecting, organizing, and distributing content on a weekly, monthly, and quarterly basis, and ensuring proper archiving.

Team Coordination: Facilitate effective communication and collaboration among various teams, including designers, developers, content creators, and strategists. Assign tasks, set priorities, and ensure team members have the necessary resources to complete their work. This role requires regular communication with team members, executive leadership, clients, vendors, and freelancers.

Risk Management: Identify potential risks and develop contingency plans to mitigate them. Proactively address project-related challenges, adapting strategies as needed to ensure successful project completion.

Continuous Process Improvement: Regularly assess internal processes to ensure maximum productivity, and delivery of the highest level of service to clients.

**Requirements:**  
Experience: Minimum of 2+ years of project management experience. **Must have experience in monday.com. Experience in digital agency a plus.**

Digital Marketing Proficiency: Strong understanding of digital marketing strategies, including SEO, SEM, social media, and content marketing. Project Management Skills: Proven track record of successfully managing multiple projects simultaneously, delivering high-quality results on time and within budget. Experience with project management tools and methodologies.

Communication and Leadership: Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Ability to lead and motivate cross-functional teams, foster collaboration, and build strong relationships with clients.

Organizational and Problem-Solving Skills: Strong organizational skills with exceptional attention to detail. Ability to identify potential issues, think critically, and develop creative solutions.

Adaptability: Comfortable working in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment. Ability to adapt quickly to changing priorities and manage ambiguity effectively.

**Schedule**  
This is a full-time position, which can be either remote or based out of our Port Washington (Long Island), NY office. We offer a hybrid schedule with employees working out of the Long Island, NY office on Monday, Tuesday and Thursday. Employees are able to work remotely on Wednesday and Friday.

To apply, please submit your resume and a cover letter explaining why you would be a great addition to our team.
